code:
# @param {String} s1
# @param {String} s2
# @param {Integer} x
# @return {Integer}
def min_operations(s1, s2, x)
  # Early return if x <= 1, as flipping any two bits is always preferable or equal to flipping adjacent bits
  return -1 if x <= 1 && s1 != s2
  
  diff_pairs = 0
  i = 0
  while i < s1.length
    # When current bits are different
    if s1[i] != s2[i]
      # If next bit exists and is also different, prefer flipping adjacent bits at cost 1
      if i+1 < s1.length && s1[i+1] != s2[i+1]
        i += 1 # Skip the next bit as it's handled by flipping adjacent bits
      else
        # Increment count for pairs to flip at cost x
        diff_pairs += 1
      end
    end
    i += 1
  end

  # Calculate total cost considering the number of different pairs and individual flips
  # Minimize cost by choosing between flipping adjacent bits and pairs at cost x
  total_cost = diff_pairs * x
  total_cost
end
